Prove that if <math display="inline">\theta</math> is not valid, then <math display="inline">\theta_{P}</math> is not a tautology. Deduce that if <math display="inline">\theta_{P}</math> is a tautology, then <math display="inline">\theta</math> is valid.

== Proof ==

* Let <math display="inline">\mathfrak{L}</math> be a first-order language, and <math display="inline">\phi</math> an <math display="inline">\mathfrak{L}</math>-formula, and finally after performing [[Formula Conversion from FOL to PL|the algorithm]] on <math display="inline">\phi</math> let <math display="inline">A_1, \ldots , A_{n}</math> be the propositional variables that occur in <math display="inline">\phi_P</math>.

* Each <math display="inline">A_{i}</math> corresponds to a subformula of <math display="inline">\phi</math>, so let <math display="inline">\psi _{i}</math> be the corresponding subformula. And we define the truth assignment function as <math display="block">v_{\mathfrak{A} } \left(A_{i} \right) = \begin{cases}  \text{ if } \mathfrak{A} \models \psi _{i}   \\ F \text{ otherwise }   \end{cases}</math>

* And we claim that <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \not\models \phi \Leftrightarrow v_{\mathfrak{A} } \left( \phi _{P}  \right) = F</math> or equivalently, that is <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \phi  \Leftrightarrow v_{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\phi _{P}  \right) = T</math>. It shall be proven via induction on the complexity of <math display="inline">\phi</math>.
** If <math display="inline">\phi</math> is an atomic formula, then via the algorithm, the whole formula is replaced by <math display="inline">A_{1}</math>, and <math display="block">v_{\mathfrak{A} } \left(A_{1} \right) = \begin{cases} T \text{ if } \mathfrak{A} \models \phi  \\ F \text{ otherwise }   \end{cases}</math>And so if we assume <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \phi</math> then <math display="inline">v_{\mathfrak{A} } \left(A_{1} \right) = T</math>, and if <math display="inline">v_{\mathfrak{A} } \left(A_{1} \right) = T</math> it is only because <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \phi</math>.
** Else if <math display="inline">\phi</math> is of the form <math display="inline">\left( \forall x \right) \left( \alpha \right)</math>, then again, by the algorithm, the whole statement is replaced by a single propositional variable, and so by the same argument as above, we obtain the result.
** Now, for <math display="inline">\phi</math> being <math display="inline">\left( \neg  \alpha  \right)</math>, following structural induction one assumes that <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \alpha \Leftrightarrow \bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\alpha _{P} \right) = T</math>. 
*** And then what follows: <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \left( \neg \alpha  \right) \Leftrightarrow \mathfrak{A} \models \alpha \stackrel{\text{IH}}{\Leftrightarrow}  \bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\alpha _{P} \right) = T \Leftrightarrow \bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\left( \neg \alpha \right)  _{P} \right)= F</math>
** We consider <math display="inline">\phi</math> of the form <math display="inline">\left( \alpha \lor \beta  \right)</math>
*** <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \not\models \left( \alpha \lor \beta  \right) \Leftrightarrow \mathfrak{A} \not\models \alpha \text{ and } \mathfrak{A} \not\models \beta</math> then via the induction hypothesis one obtains <math display="inline">\bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\alpha _{P} \right)= F</math> as well as <math display="inline">\bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\beta  _{P} \right)= F</math>
*** By the definition of the truth assignment function we obtain <math display="inline">\bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left( \left( \alpha \lor \beta  \right)   _{P} \right)=  F</math> (Since <math>(\alpha)_P \lor (\beta)_P = (\alpha \lor \beta )_P</math>) and so indeed we have <math display="block">\mathfrak{A} \models \phi  \Leftrightarrow \bar{v} _{\mathfrak{A} } \left(\phi _{P} \right) = T</math>

Now if given a first order formula <math display="inline">\theta</math> that is not valid, then by itâ€™s definition, we know that there is a structure <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A}</math> wherein <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \not \models \theta</math>, by what we have previously shown, we have a truth assignment function where <math display="inline">\bar{v} \left(\theta  _{P} \right) = F</math> (Namely, the one we just constructed) and so <math display="inline">\theta _{P}</math> is not a tautology, by the contrapositive, one has that if <math display="inline">\theta  _{P}</math> is a tautology , then <math display="inline">\theta</math> is valid.
